title: Colombian-Style Barbecued Beef Ribs Recipe
full_text:
Colombian-Style Barbecued Beef Ribs Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
5 mins
Cook
4 hrs
Active
10 mins
Resting Time
10 mins
Total
4 hrs 15 mins
Serves
4 servings
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
12
beef rib
bones
(preferably in
2
(
6-bone) racks
, see note)
Kosher salt
and freshly ground black pepper
1
recipe
ají
Directions
Season ribs generously on all sides with salt and pepper.
Light one chimney full of charcoal.
When all the charcoal is lit and covered with gray ash, pour out and spread the coals evenly over half of coal grate. Alternatively, set half the burners of a gas grill to high heat. Set cooking grate in place, cover grill, and allow to preheat for 5 minutes.
Clean
and
oil
the grilling grate.
Place ribs over cooler side of grill and cook, turning occasionally, until a knife inserted between the bones shows little resistance and deep brown crust has developed, about 4 hours. Remove from grill, allow to rest for 10 minutes, and serve with ají.
Notes
Ask your butcher for the rib bones from a prime rib roast, preferably with about a half inch of meat still attached.
Special Equipment
Grill
